name: timbale
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mixture of thinly cut meat, fish, or vegetables, cooked in a mould (= a hollow container), sometimes with a pastry case: The chicken was pan fried in a spicy sauce and served with a timbale of rice. The dish of the day was a fresh crab timbale with mint yogurt. Butter the timbale mouldsmolds and line with pastry.
More examplesFewer examplesA timbale of mushroom and potato comes with the baked fish.Warm the leek timbales in a steamer before serving.I had a green salad to start, followed by a vegetable and potato timbale.The fish was cooked in a rich creamy sauce and then baked in a small timbale shell.
